alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 7:58PM MST until February 23 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .Snowfall will continue to diminish across the Front Range foothills and adjacent plains this evening. There are still a few bands of moderate snowfall over the plains but any additional accumulation will be an inch or less. You can still expect icy and snowpacked roads. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills ongoing. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Fort Collins, and Briggsdale. * WHEN...Until 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County
